intro: Mariscus pohlii subsp. bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia mariscus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
